page.title: 14Local Weather
page.content: On a{sunny}summer day, there can be few more{pleasant}places to live in than Hexhamshire. However, it is not always like that.According to our local weather expert, the{average {annual rainfall}for the area is {829.1mm}. In recent years, the lowest annual rainfall was in 1982 -744mm-and the highest in 1984 - 892.4mm.In November 1984, 64.1mm fell in 2 days! The{prevailing wind}is from the west, and it can be very strong indeed. You can tell this from the shape of the trees! In winter it can cause huge {snowdrifts}, which even with modern snow clearing machines, can take several days to clear. Some people come to school by tractor then! If we look in the school log book, we find that most years some people are cut off. In 1985, however,there was some snow but no drifting.
